snippet: Defenders and critics in France agree that the actual impact of a law banning full-face veils in public places has been far less dramatic than the politicized prologue to it.
abstract: Defenders and critics in France agree that a law banning full-face veils in public places, passed in April 2011, has had much less of a dramatic impact than anticipated, largely because of tolerance from most Muslims and the police.

byline.original: By STEVEN ERLANGER and ELVIRE CAMUS
byline.contributor: Steven Erlanger reported from Paris, and Elvire Camus from Paris and Aubervilliers, France.

lead_paragraph: Defenders and critics in France agree that the actual impact of a law banning full-face veils in public places has been far less dramatic than the politicized prologue to it.

headline.seo: Tolerance Eases Impact of French Ban on Full-Face Veils
headline.main: In a Ban, a Measure of European Tolerance
headline.print_headline: In a Ban, a Measure of European Tolerance

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
